business.headline: HDFC Bank Q2 results: Net profit rises 5% to Rs 16,820 croreHDFC Bank's net interest income (NII), a key measure of profitability, came in at Rs 30,114 crore, reflecting a 10% year-on-year increase, although slightly below the market expectation of Rs 30,306 crore.

Karnataka to impose cess on Zomato, Uber, payments to support gig workersKarnataka Labour Minister Santosh Lad said that the charge would be levied only on transport and not on the purchase of products.

Disney-Reliance venture to stream live sports exclusively on Hotstar: ReportWhile Reliance's JioCinema currently streams IPL cricket, Hotstar holds rights to other prestigious events like the International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, the English Premier League, and the Pro Kabaddi League.

Ashneer Grover withdraws mismanagement plea against BharatPe from NCLTThe plea alleged mismanagement and oppressive conduct by the fintech company's board. The withdrawal of the plea follows a settlement reached between Grover and BharatPe on September 30, 2024.

India to impose laptop import restrictions to boost local manufacturing: ReportThe planned restrictions, if enforced, could impact the country's IT hardware market, which is currently valued at between $8 billion and $10 billion.
Sensex, Nifty close in green as banking, metal stocks lift marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 218.14 points to close at, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.20 points to end at 24,854.05.

DA hike by 3%: Check new salary, arrear calculations for employees, pensionersThe DA hike increase is effective from July 1, 2024, and was confirmed during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

India's growth rate shines bright in global economy, says Ajay Banga A lot of that growth is in India, is driven by the domestic market as well, which actually is a healthy sign, in some ways, said Ajay Banga, World Bank president.

IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

Explained: Why European Central Bank cut interest rates againECB cuts interest rates: This marks the first time the ECB has implemented back-to-back rate cuts since it began its current cycle of easing in response to falling inflation rates.

RBI action against Navi Finserv, 3 other NBFCs: What it means for customersRBI's regulatory action comes in response to concerns over their loan pricing policies and other regulatory violations, sparking questions about the implications for customers.

Did not run away, will return to India: Byju Raveendran amid insolvency crisisSpeaking during his first virtual press conference in four years, Raveendran refuted rumours that he had fled India to avoid the ongoing insolvency crisis.
Explained: Why Manappuram Finance shares crashed 16% todayAt around 10:30 am shares of Manappuram Finance were down 16.15% to Rs 148.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty decline in early trade; Manappuram Finance tanks 15%Manappuram Finance Share Price: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 400.17 points to 80,606.44 at 10:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 96.85 points to trade at 24,653.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Drone targets Israeli PM Netanyahu's home days after Hamas chief's killingThe Israeli Prime Minister's spokesperson said a drone was launched towards Benjamin Netanyahu's private home in the northern town of Caesarea.

They're clearly on notice: Canada on remaining Indian diplomatsCanada's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Melanie Joly, said that the Justin Trudeau government "will not tolerate any diplomats who endanger the safety of Canadians".

Maha Vikas Aghadi says no dispute, seat talks to be completed tonightThe Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) dismissed speculation of a rift within its partners and insisted that everything was well and stated that seat-sharing for the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly polls would be announced soon.

Baba Siddique had links with Dawood, claims arrested Bishnoi gang shooterSpeaking to the media in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang said that Baba Siddique was killed because he was not a good man and was associated with gangster Dawood Ibrahim.

At 67, Sunny Deol still packs 'Dhai Kilo Ka' punch without reinventing himselfSunny Deol, at 67, remains a beloved Bollywood icon, delivering powerful performances without conforming to trends. His authenticity and emotional depth continue to resonate with audiences.

Over 10 flights receive bomb threats in 24 hours, 70 hoax calls this weekInvestigating agencies have identified some common phrases used in these fake threats, such as 'blood will spread everywhere' and 'this is not a joke.' However, no substantial progress has been made, except the arrest of a 17-year-old boy.

Bigg Boss 18 promo: Salman Khan says he didn't want to be on the setSalman Khan expressed reluctance to be on the Bigg Boss 18 set during Weekend Ka Vaar episode. The actor resumed the show's shoot with heightened security after politician Baba Siddique's death.
Why do you doze off on the couch but are wide awake in bed?Ever find yourself dozing off on the couch, only to be wide awake the moment you hit the bed? Let's find out from experts why this happens.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Why shooters from UP, and not Maharashtra, were hired to kill Baba SiddiqueOne of the five accused arrested by Mumbai Police on Friday claimed that they were initially meant to carry out the hit job on Baba Siddique. However, the contract was given to shooters from Uttar Pradesh and Haryana.

Karan Johar silences troll accusing him of using Ozempic to lose weightKaran Johar addressed accusations of using the diabetes drug, Ozempic, for fast weight loss. This comes after Maheep Kapoor spoke about the drug in Fabulous Lives vs Bollywood Wives.

Khamenei says death of 'heroic mujahid' Sinwar won't stop 'Axis of Resistance'Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, who ordered the October 7 attack on Israel, was killed on Friday. The Israeli Defence Force (IDF) announced Sinwar's death on Thursday, October 17.

Are Bollywood re-releases a profitable box office model? Is the film industry really gaining something by re-releasing Bollywood movies in theatres or is it just another blind trend that everyone wants to follow? We talked to the trade experts to understand the entire phenomenon behind Bollywood re-releases and how much money they have really collected at the box office.

The Hamas, Hezbollah leaders bumped off by Israel since October 7 attackAs the one-year anniversary of the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza passed, here is a detailed account of the key figures of Hamas and Hezbollah, part of Iran's 'Axis of Resistance', killed in Israeli operations so far.

Even if an ant gets a threat, Bishnoi's name crops up: Gangster's lawyerIn an interview with India Today, Rajni Khatri, Lawrence Bishnoi's lawyer, said there was no evidence linking the gangster's involvement to the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique.

Baba Siddique's son's photo found in accused's phone, was sent via SnapchatZeeshan Siddique is a Congress MLA and represents the Vandre East constituency. He is also the President of Mumbai Youth Congress.
When astronauts discovered Earth from the MoonThe Apollo 8 mission was the first to send humans around the Moon. Its primary purpose was to scout future lunar landing sites.

Railways to re-appoint retired employees under 65 to overcome staff shortageThe retired employees will be appointed for a period of two years with the possibility of an extension. General Managers of all zones have been authorised to hire retired employees based on criteria such as medical fitness and performance ratings from the last five years.

Rishabh Pant slog sweeps Tim Southee for 107m six: Rahul, Glenn Phillips in shockRishabh Pant's slog-sweep six landed outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. He hit a 107-m six against Tim Southee and left KL Rahul and Glenn Phillips stunned.

Sarfaraz Khan receives standing ovation from Bengaluru crowd after superb 150India vs New Zealand: Sarfaraz Khan earned a well-deserved standing ovation from both the crowd and the Indian dressing room after Tim Southee brought an end to his marathon 150-run innings in the second session.

Moulded in Mumbai maidans, Sarfaraz Khan leads India's heroic recovery in BengaluruSarfaraz Khan's remarkable maiden Test century against New Zealand in Bengaluru highlights his talent and determination. Overcoming challenges and fitness concerns, his journey reflects resilience and support from cricketing icons like Sunil Gavaskar.

Watch: Virat Kohli comes out to check rain, Bengaluru crowd eruptsIndia vs New Zealand: Virat Kohli received massive cheers at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. The batter walked out of the dressing room to check the state of the rain and was welcomed by huge roars.

Street smart Sarfaraz Khan knows how to put pressure back on bowlers: KumbleFormer India captain and coach Anil Kumble hailed Sarfaraz Khan for his stunning century in Bengaluru. Kumble said that Sarfaraz was street-smart and knew how to put pressure back on the bowlers.

Trent Alexander-Arnold not distracted by Real Madrid links: Liverpool boss SlotLiverpool coach Arne Slot assures fans that Trent Alexander-Arnold remains committed to his role at Anfield, despite ongoing transfer rumours linking him to Real Madrid. Wanindu Hasaranga returns as Sri Lanka announce squad for ODIs vs West IndiesSri Lanka gears up for the ODI series against West Indies with key players returning from injury and fresh faces earning call-ups. With momentum from their 2-1 T20I series win, the hosts aim to maintain their winning run at Pallekele.

IND vs NZ: 'Crisis man' Sarfaraz Khan hits maiden Test hundred in BengaluruSarfaraz Khan hit his maiden Test hundred on Day 4 of the 1st Test between India and New Zealand in Bengaluru. He led India's charge and took the team out of trouble.

Heavily strapped Rishabh Pant braves injury, comes out to bat on Day 4India vs New Zealand: A heavily strapped Rishabh Pant came out to bat on Day 4 of the Bengaluru Test match on Saturday, October 19. Pant had not taken the field on Day 3 after getting hit on the knee with the ball.

Abhishek Nayar wants 'domestic beast' Sarfaraz Khan to score 300 in BengaluruIndia vs New Zealand: India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar wants domestic beast Sarfaraz Khan to translate his form into international cricket and score a triple hundred in the Bengaluru Test. India still trail by 125 runs at the start of Day 4 of the Test match.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
